deregulate.translation[0].definitions[0]: to remove government rules and controls from some types of business activity
The decision to deregulate the banks was criticised.

deregulate.translation[1].definitions[0]: to remove or reduce the number of government controls on a particular business activity, done to make companies work more effectively and to increase competition
After internal US flights were deregulated in 1978, the industry quickly became more competitive.
The pressure to deregulate came from inside the Stock Exchange.
